Assignment 3: ROS Mobile Robots Simulator’s documentation!

Indices and tables

  • Index

  • Module Index

  • Search Page

UserInterface Module

This is the main ROS node about the final assignment of the Research Track 1 course of the Robotics Engineering Master Degree.

Overview

The simulation involves a mobile robot positioned inside an environment, and it’s equipped with a laser scanner in order to detect the presence of obstacles, such as the walls of the environment. The aim of the project is to develop an architecture to control the robot in the environment.

The software will rely on the move_base and gmapping packages for localizing the robot and plan the motion.

The implemented architecture allows the user to perform three different robot behavior modes, in particular:

  1. Reach autonomously the coordinate (x, y) entered by the user, thus obtaining an autonomous guide of the robot;

  2. Let the user to drive the robot with the keyboard, thus having the opportunity to try a manual robot driving experience;

  3. Let the user to guide the robot with the keyboard with assistance to avoid collisions with obstacles.

In addition, the user interface allows to reset the position of the robot to the initial state or to exit the program by closing all active nodes.

Service:

/goal_coordinates to set the goal coordinates that the robot has to reach autonomously /manual_drive to drive manually the robot with the keyboard /gazebo/reset_world to reset the position of the robot to the initial state

scripts.user_interface_controller.autonomous_drive()[source]

Function for autonomous driving of the robot: the user sets the goal coordinates and checks whether the set goal is reached.

Service:

/goal_coordinates

The user goal coordinates (x,y) is passed to the service GoalCoordinates, advertised by autonomous_drive.

scripts.user_interface_controller.driving_modality(user_input)[source]

Function used to decide the behavior of the robot according to the user input

Parameters

user_input (Int) – user’s input of the selected driving modes.

scripts.user_interface_controller.main()[source]

Main function of the program which starts the service for resetting the gazebo environment and the user interface for selecting the robot driving modalities.

scripts.user_interface_controller.manual_drive()[source]

Function for manual driving of the robot: calls the service to manage the input from keyboard.

Service:

/manual_drive

The user can select the type of driving: 1. Full manual driving experience, or 2. Assisted manual driving experience with obstacle avoidance.

The type is passed to the service ManualDrive, advertised by manual_drive.

scripts.user_interface_controller.user_interface()[source]

Function to print the user interface with the available driving modes on the screen.

Returns

user’s input, value of the selected mode.

Return type

user_input (Int)

AutonomousDrive Module

This node implements the automatic driving mode of the robot from it’s current position, to the one inserted by the user. It’s also implemented a time-condition to evaluate if the desired position is reachable or not.

Service:

/goal_coordinates

Action:

/move_base /actionlib

scripts.autonomous_drive.autonomous_drive_server()[source]

Function that initialises the autonomous driving service.

Uses the service handler to manage the GoalCoordinates service, returning the values from the menage_auto_drive function.

scripts.autonomous_drive.max_time = rospy.Duration[30000000000]

Maximum duration to reach the set goal

scripts.autonomous_drive.menage_auto_drive(request)[source]

Function that manages the autonomous driving service, waiting an appropriate time to check if the target is reached.

Parameters

request (Float64 x, Float64 y) – goal coordinates coming from the service

Returns

if the target is reached successfully -1: if the target can’t be reached and the goal has canceled

Return type

1

ManualDrive Module

This node implements the lauching of the two manual driving modalities:

  1. the user is able to drive the robot without any constraint, full manual driving experience;

  2. the user drives the robot but there will be a collision control avoiding the user to hit obstacles, assisted manual driving experience.

Service:

/manual_drive

scripts.manual_drive.manual_drive_server()[source]

Function that initialises the manual driving service

Uses the service handler to manage the ManualDrive service, returning the values from the menage_manual_drive function.

scripts.manual_drive.menage_manual_drive(request)[source]

Function that manages the manual driving service, called by both full and assisted manual driving mode choosen the launcher the specific mode.

Parameters

request (Int32) – manual driving modality selected by the user

The user choice is passed to the os to launch the chosen launch file.

AssistedManualDrive Module

This node implements the assisted manual driving mode of the robot with obstacle avoidance.

Subscribes to:

/collision_cmd_vel to remap the velocity commands for the obstacle avoidance /scan to get the laser scanning of the map, distance measurements

Publishes to:

/cmd_vel the velocity commands.

scripts.assisted_manual_drive.assisted_driving(data)[source]

Function called each time arrives a message from the LaserScan topic. This function gets the minimum value among 5 regions of the laser scan and take a decision setting the velocity to avoid obstacles.

Parameters

data – variable name for the message that is passed in, sensor_msgs

Returns

global variable that modifies the velocity of the robot based on its position

Return type

vel_msg

scripts.assisted_manual_drive.assisted_manual_drive()[source]

Function that initialises the subscribers for the assisted driving mode, inputKey_node subscribing to the topics Twist and LaserScan.

scripts.assisted_manual_drive.callBack_remap(data)[source]

Callback function to copy the new topic collision_cmd_vel on vel_msg which can be modified or not

Parameters

data – variable name for the message that is passed in, geometry_msgs

scripts.assisted_manual_drive.threshold = 0.7

Global variable of the distance threshold to avoid collision with obstacles
